intro: Matelea urophylla, commonly known as the pink morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many species of vines and herbs. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often opening in the morning. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a velvety texture, while its stems are trailing and can climb if supported. Matelea urophylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
